bug.author: FGeri
bug.summary: [BUG] Pipelining multiple augmentations return wrong transformation matrix
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Transformation matrices get calculated wrongly when fed though more than one augmentation. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>>>> import kornia as K >>> import torch >>> from kornia.augmentation import random_generator as rg >>> input = torch.tensor([[1., 0., 0.], [0., 1., 2.,], [0., 0., 1.,]]).view((1,1,3,3))
>>> params = rg.random_rotation_generator(batch_size=1,degrees=torch.tensor([90.,90.])) >>> hflip = K.augmentation.RandomHorizontalFlip(1.0,return_transform=True) >>> rot = K.augmentation.RandomRotation(degrees=90.0, return_transform=True) >>> rotated_img,T_rot = rot(input,params) >>> final_img_true, T_hflip = hflip(rotated_img) >>> T_true = T_hflip @ T_rot >>> final_img,T = hflip(rot(input,params))
>>> assert torch.allclose(final_img_true,final_img), "Result images don't match." >>> assert torch.allclose(T_true,T), "Transformations don't match." AssertionError: Transformations don't match.
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
A pipeline of multiple the augmentation moduls should return the correct transformation matrix. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch version: 1.6.0 Is debug build: False CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.2 OS: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS (x86_64) GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.5.0-3ubuntu1~18.04) 7.5.0 Clang version: Could not collect CMake version: version 3.18.1 Python version: 3.6 (64-bit runtime) Is CUDA available: True CUDA runtime version: 10.2.89 GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce RTX 2080 Ti Nvidia driver version: 440.44 cuDNN version: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.6.5 Versions of relevant libraries: [pip3] numpy==1.19.1 [pip3] torch==1.6.0 [pip3] torchvision==0.7.0

comments.comment: If I remember right, shouldn't be T_true = T_rot @ T_hflip?

For applying a transformation given by a matrix we have to multiply with it from the left. So since we first rotate an v=[x,y,1] point v_rotated = T_rot @ v, then v_final = T_hflip @ v_rotated. Fixing this in the AugmentationBase doesn't break any tests, so ops might not have been mixed resulting in equal transformation matrices hence order of the matrices did't matter.
Can you give a PR to fix this?
Sure, I'll write some tests and open a PR.
